attributes.action: Scrap the upcoming Housing and Planning Bill.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill would cause significant losses in income for over 200,000 homes. It also pushes tenants to buy their homes, through Right-to-Buy, but this is unaffordable for most. 

The new bill proposes that a combined household income of £30,000+ (£40,000 in London) should have to pay average market-rate rent to stay in their property. Tenants in London could see a loss of £12k a year. This would force many out of their homes, and destroy the principles of social housing.
attributes.background: The Housing and Planning Bill is currently being debated in parliament, and primarily affects those in social housing. It could lead to social cleansing in larger cities.
